info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 2:28PM CDT until March 19 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
Forecast trends this morning have decreased snow accumulations across the Sandhills and portions of Central Nebraska. The combination of wind and snow will lead to blizzard or near blizzard conditions over far southwestern Nebraska into portions of the eastern Sandhills and central Nebraska. Accumulating snow is also expected over the Pine Ridge of Sheridan County and a winter weather advisory is in effect for the northeastern Nebraska Panhandle.
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of one to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph.
* WHERE...Loup County.
* WHEN...From 1 AM to 2 PM CDT Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.
Call Nebraska 5 1 1 for the latest road information.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 2 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IS CANCELLED
